SENT.plain: Alzheimer's disease is classified as a degenerative dementia while vascular dementia is known to be associated with atherothrombosis and classical vascular risk factors
However, over the last decade, there is increasing evidence of the role of haemostatic factors and inflammatory mechanisms in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease
Serum markers of hypercoagulability and markers of inflammation could lead to thrombosis, accelerated atherogenesis and resulting dementia of both Alzheimer's and vascular dementia
In this case control study, we studied these serum markers of coagulation and inflammation in patients suffering from dementia
